intro: Metarungia longistrobus, commonly known as the long-stalked metarungia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals, and it produces small, round berries. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
